title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 November 2015 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:02 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:24 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:21 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <mflorea> has quit  
08:21 <cjd> has quit  
08:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <Denis> Hi guys, I was wondering why org.xwiki.wiki.internal.descriptor.document.WikiDescriptorDocumentHelper is not in the API ?  
09:10 <Denis> or at least why it is internal  
09:10 <vmassol> hi Denis  
09:10 <vmassol> to not expose it? :)  
09:11 <vmassol> we do this frequently when we don't want to expose internal tools  
09:11 <Denis> yes, which is a bit of a problem when you want to write a WikiPropertyGroup  
09:11 <vmassol> now why, I don't know. I don't even know what this component does. I guess the only person who could answer is guillaumeD  
09:12 <Denis> it allows you to know which is the document that hold the wiki descriptor  
09:12 <Denis> and I need this to store another object in the wiki descriptor, to hold my own wiki properties  
09:12 <vmassol> note that as a public component I wouldn't like its name too much but that's another matter ;)  
09:12 <vmassol> (I don't like Helper as component name)  
09:13 <Denis> agreed  
09:13 <vmassol> I probably didn't say anything at the tme since it was internal  
09:13 <vmassol> :)  
09:14 <vmassol> guillaume should connect in less than 1 hour  
09:14 <Denis> just seeing that we have somehow opposed situation, we allow extending the memory descriptor with wiki groups, but the implementor of the wiki group would need to implement fully his own storage, since the document when we store information is considered implementation detail, and retrieving it is internal stuffs  
09:14 <Denis> s/when/where  
09:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <vmassol> Denis: actually Guillaume is off for 2 weeks

15:58 <vmassol> mflorea: didn't realize you had one wiki page unit test at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/51ed5d0df88a9ca100103e220897a371775bad4b/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-livetable/xwiki-platform-livetable-ui/src/test/java/org/xwiki/livetable/LiveTableResultsTest.java cool :)  
15:58 <vmassol> (or maybe I did but forgot, redisocvering now)  
15:58 <mflorea> :)  
15:58 <vmassol> need to analyze it at some point to see how to improve the fwk  
15:58 <vmassol> right now it's probably still too complex to create such unit tests  
15:59 <mflorea> I did a small improvement recently https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4692437504ab498a661502334c157fab1f196cef#diff-b88d6f9fa8086d801e7d4ad351b4adec  
16:00 <mflorea> but judging from https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-livetable/xwiki-platform-livetable-ui/src/test/java/org/xwiki/livetable/LiveTableResultsTest.java it's not complex  
16:01 <vmassol> mflorea: you didn't spend too long writing it?  
16:01 <vmassol> it took me a while to write the first such unit test on my side  
16:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: that's because you wrote the framework at the same time  
16:01 <tmortagne> always hard the first time  
16:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: sure, I mean when taking that out of course  
16:02 <mflorea> I spent some time initially yes, but that allowed me to write a new test now in 5 minutes  
16:02 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/51ed5d0df88a9ca100103e220897a371775bad4b  
16:06 <vmassol> evalica: don't forget playgroundtemplate  
16:06 <vmassol> :)  
16:06 <vmassol> (see step 8 of http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Migrations#HUpgradeXWiki )

16:59 <vmassol> ok  
16:59 <vmassol> thanks
